item.title: How Trump's tariffs push some importers into risky, high-cost loans
item.description: President Trump's tariffs can create a cash crunch for importers. They have to pay the tariff bill before they can sell their products. Some have turned to a costly form of credit. But what looks like a helping hand can turn out to be a financial chokehold.

item.title: Revised Labor Department figures show hiring in 2025 was lower than reported
item.description: The U.S. job market perked up a bit to start the new year, but revised figures from the Labor Department show hiring was much weaker in 2025 than initially reported.

item.title: U.S. unexpectedly adds 130,000 jobs in January after a weak 2025
item.description: U.S. employers added 130,000 jobs in January as the unemployment rate dipped to 4.3% from 4.4% in December. Annual revisions show that job growth last year was far weaker than initially reported.
